private_information: Travel time Russian Hill to Golden Gate Park is 21 minutes
Travel time Golden Gate Park to Russian Hill is 19 minutes
You arrive at Russian Hill at 09:00AM
schedule_generator.goal: Generate candidate meeting schedules for the day that maximize the number of friends met while respecting travel times and known availabilities.

private_information: John will be at Golden Gate Park from 13:00 to 18:15
You would like to meet John for a minimum of 90 minutes
feasibility_checker.goal: Evaluate candidate schedules for feasibility against friend availabilities and minimum meeting durations.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate candidate schedules and feasibility results to produce a final PDDL planning domain and problem that select the best feasible schedule optimizing number of friends met and satisfying constraints.

public_information: Travel time from Russian Hill to Golden Gate Park is 21 minutes
Travel time from Golden Gate Park to Russian Hill is 19 minutes
You arrive at Russian Hill at 09:00AM
John will be at Golden Gate Park from 13:00 to 18:15
Desired minimum meeting duration with John is 90 minutes

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with PDDL problems targeting the FastDownward solver. Always provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file. Enclose the pddl domain between <domain></domain> tags and the pddl problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: Your name is schedule_generator. You are in an environment with the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following knowledge: {agents->schedule_generator->private_information} This is the global goal to solve: {agents->schedule_generator->goal} Think step by step and provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file targeting the FastDownward solver. If you miss some information, do not make assumptions, just give plans that concern the information you have. Enclose the pddl domain between <domain></domain> tags and the pddl problem between <problem></problem> tags.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with PDDL problems targeting the FastDownward solver. Always provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file. Enclose the pddl domain between <domain></domain> tags and the pddl problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: Your name is feasibility_checker. You are in an environment with the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following knowledge: {agents->feasibility_checker->private_information} This is the global goal to solve: {agents->feasibility_checker->goal} Think step by step and provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file that encode feasibility checks for candidate schedules and verify minimum meeting durations and time windows for friends. Target the FastDownward solver. Enclose the pddl domain between <domain></domain> tags and the pddl problem between <problem></problem> tags.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-agent PDDL problems targeting the FastDownward solver. Always provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file. Enclose the pddl domain between <domain></domain> tags and the pddl problem between <problem></problem> tags. If there are multiple agents, keep their actions distinct.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. There are two agents producing PDDL artifacts that you must integrate to solve the planning task. You will receive their PDDL domains and problems. Integrate them to produce a single consistent PDDL domain and problem that selects the best feasible schedule optimizing the number of friends met while satisfying travel times and time window constraints. Keep actions from schedule_generator and feasibility_checker distinct. Here is the task goal: {agents->orchestrator->goal} Here is the PDDL from the first agent: {pddl_schedule_generator} Here is the PDDL from the second agent: {pddl_feasibility_checker} Think step by step and provide a combined PDDL domain and PDDL problem targeting the FastDownward solver. Enclose the pddl domain between <domain></domain> tags and the pddl problem between <problem></problem> tags.
